meanings.definition: The craft or occupation of a mason.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather learned masonry from his father.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful fireplace was a result of skilled masonry.
meanings.sent3: The masonry expert built a tiny house out of candy.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in masonry was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle's masonry stood the test of time.

meanings.definition: The work or products of a mason.
meanings.sent1: The masonry displayed in the museum was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: He admired the intricate details of the masonry on the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The masonry on the sidewalk seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The masonry of the bridge connected the two sides seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The masonry of the statue captured the essence of strength.

meanings.definition: The art or technique of building with stone, brick, or concrete.
meanings.sent1: Learning masonry requires patience and practice.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization mastered the art of masonry.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician tried to perform tricks with masonry.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity in masonry was like painting with stones.
meanings.sent5: The masonry of the castle walls was both sturdy and elegant.
